0.name: City Entrance
desc: "     You are at the entrance to a small underground city. A great adamantine
gate lies open to the west allowing entrance into the city.  There is a large
fresco on the gates...
A large adamantine gate with a giant spider shaped fresco stands here:

exits.desc: A huge gate opens to the west allowing entrance into the city.
A small hole leads upwards, to the Dracoliches cave.

1.name: City street
desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate street going north-south. A large gate
lies to the east while a building lies to the west.

2.name: City street
2.desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street going north and west.

3.name: City street
desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street going east-west. A large house
stands to the south.

4.name: Inside House Udrinor
desc: "   You are standing inside of the grounds of House Udrinor. This house is
small, being the least significant of all the Drow houses in this city.
Mural's and artwork cover the walls, telling the story of the House and it's
rise to power.  House Udrinor is an old house, one of the oldest around,
surprisingly, given its lowly status. This house controls the great fields
of fungi and salt water lakes that provide most of the food for the rest of
the city.  Given that the Drow would rather die than farm, it is no wonder
that this house has maintained a foothold for a long, long time.

5.name: Throne Room of House Udrinor
desc: "   You are standing in the Throne room of House Udrinor.  Here the Matron
Mother, Haeltyna Udrinor, resides over the workings of her house and the
politics that the position brings with it.  A large throne, carved from a
giant mushroom, dominates the room.  A small blood-altar sits quietly in
a corner, ready for the sacrificial work of the priestesses.  And every-
where there are patterns of spiders crawling over fields of mushrooms.
Very fitting for the House that feeds a city.

6.name: City street
desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street going east-west. To the north
is a large building.

7.name: City street
desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street leading north and east. To the
south is an extremely large house.

8.name: Inside House Sardavac
desc: "   You are standing inside the grounds of house Sardavac.  This house is
small, but there seems to be lot of ornate artwork and decoration around,
telling the story of the House and it's rise to power.  House Sardavac, it
seems, is a young house, only a few centuries old, which is nothing in the
life-span of the Drow.  It gained prominence from the trade of fine art
and that it produced, supplying the city with fearsome works that celebrate
their cruel and machiavellian deity, Lloth.

9.name: Throne Room of House Sardavac
desc: "   Never have you seen such a wondrous and frightful sight!  The throne
room of House Sardavac almost gleams and drips with evil, every inch of
the room celebrating the chaotically cruel nature of the Drow deity, Lloth.
A vast throne, adorned with carvings, formed of perfectly white roots of
living plants, occupies most of the room and provides a place for the
Matron Mother of House Sardavac, Qitlara Sardavac, a place to administer to
the workings of her House.

10.name: Outside House Parastric
desc: "   You standing on a street outside of House Parastric.  This house,
carved in to a might stalactite, is the biggest in this part of the city.
Yet it is rumoured that House Parastric is not the most powerful around.
How odd.

exits.desc: A large gate lies to the west.

11.name: Inside House Parastric
desc: "   You are standing inside the grounds of House Parastric.  The walls, the
furniture, everything that you can see, seems to have been formed from the
flesh of some poor creature.  Even the artwork that depicts the rise of the
House is made of the same macabre material.  House Parastric is a relatively
old house, well known for providing the city with some of its most powerful
wizards.  So powerful in fact, that House Parastric is rumoured to have been
the first in all the realms to create Polymorphing magic.

12.name: Throne Room of House Parastric
desc: "   Even the floor in this throne room is spongy from all of the skins and
hides and fleshes that house has warped and cured and hung in decoration
over the millennia.  A gigantic altar takes pride of place in this room,
dedicated to the cruel Lloth and still dripping thick, red blood from the
last sacrifice.  The throne itself pales in comparison.  But what is more
remarkable is that the ancient Matron Mother, Indica Violenta Parastric, is
never in attendance here.  Instead she holds her audiences in her own plush
chamber just to the north.

13.name: The Chamber of Indica Violenta Parastric
desc: "   The Matron Mother of House Parastric is rumoured to be over a thousand
years old.  And that would explain why she holds her councils in her own
chamber, and not on her throne flesh to the south.  The chamber is decorated
in a surprisingly simple fashion, the walls are mostly bare, with only a
single portrait of the wizened old Matron transforming into a beauteous,
youthful Drow in a never ending, slow dance that transfixes the eye.

14.name: City street
14.desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street leading north-south and east.

15.name: City street
desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street leading south. A building is
to the west.

16.name: Cleric Academy
16.desc: "     This is the most lavish of the academies being that it is for the clerics.

17.name: City street
desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street going east-west. To the north
is a giant temple.

exits.desc: The entrance to the temple of Lloth.

18.name: Warrior's Academy
18.desc: "     This looks more like a barracks than a school.

19.name: Entrance to the Temple of Lloth
desc: "     The temple is the largest building in the city. Even it's doors are beyond
imagination. Inside of the temple entrance, the walls are made of gold and
adamantine.

20.name: Mage's Academy
desc: "     The mages academy is fairly well decorated see that the drow prefer magic
over physical power greatly.

21.name: City street
desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street going eastward. To the north is
a building.

22.name: Slave Chamber
desc: "     The room is in shambles. Straw is strewn all about the room as beds for the
unfortunate creatures who have fallen prey to drow imperialism.

23.name: City street
desc: "     You walk along a highly ornate city street leading west and south. To the
north is a relatively small house.

24.name: Inside House Moivas
desc: "   You are standing inside the grounds of House Moivas, rumoured to be the
most power Drow house in this part of the city.  Yet looks can be deceiving,
as the house is small compared to some around it, and the murals in this part
of the house are dull, dark affairs.  The story of House Moivas is one of
slavery.  This house is the one the others come to for their slave needs, and
no-one, not even the great Houses, know where they source their fodder from.

25.name: Throne Room of House Moivas
desc: "   The altar in the throne room of House Moivas has been formed from the
bones of a giant Ettin.  Whatever it had done in life, the powerful creature
now serves to collect the blood of sacrifices to the Queen of Spiders herself,
Lloth, and to bring honour to the house Moivas.  In this room the Matron of
House Moivas, Ruinia Moivas, sits on her Throne of Bones, formed from the
knuckles of a thousand slaves, administering to the needs of her House.

26.name: Entrance Way
desc: "     You stand in the entrance way to the temple which opens up to the north
into a large hallway going east and west. Small statues of spiders line the
entrance way's walls.

27.name: Hallway
desc: "     You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engraved
with pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As you
look down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.
To the north is a obsidian stairway.

28.name: Long Hallway
desc: "     You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engraved
with pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As you
look down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.

29.name: Long Hallway
desc: "     You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engraved
with pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As you
look down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.
To the north is a door.

30.name: Long Hallway
desc: "     You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engraved
with pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As you
look down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.

31.name: Long Hallway
desc: "     You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engraved
with pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As you
look down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.

32.name: Long Hallway
desc: "     You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engraved
with pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As you
look down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.
To the south is a door.

33.name: Warrior's Barracks
desc: "     The room is a complete mess. None of the beds are made, clothes and other
items have been left all about the room. Well drow warriors never were known
for neatness.

34.name: Long Hallway
desc: "     You are in a long hallway lined with adamantite. The walls are engraved
with pictures of elves and spiders. The hallway continues east and west. As you
look down the hallway you can make out one or two figures moving away from you.

35.name: Grand Stairway
desc: "     You are standing at the bottom of a giant obsidian and adamantite
stairway. The edges are trimmed with gold.

36.name: Grand Hallway
desc: "     You are standing in the middle of a grand hallway. The walls are
of the purest adamantite with gold trim. Mosaics line the walls.

37.name: Mage's Barracks
desc: "     The mage's living quarters is rather clean with the exception of a few
used component containers. It is rather well decorated as well. Cots line the
floor for the mages to sleep on. the only door is to the west.

38.name: Grand Hallway
desc: "     You are walking down a grand hallway, heavily decorated with adamantite
and gold. To the north the hall goes down a flight of stairs while a door is
too the west.

39.name: Cleric's Barracks
desc: "     The bed chamber is brightly decorated with spider shaped statues, murals
and the like. Large beds line the floor making this a comfortable room to live
in.

40.name: Grand Stairway
desc: "     You are climbing a set of obsidian stairs surrounded by adamantine walls.
To the north are a set of large golden doors.

41.name: Main Chamber
desc: "     This is the south side of a large auditorium used for services by the
drow priestesses. In the center is a large sacrificial pit and beyond that is
an altar.

42.name: Easternside of Chamber
desc: "     You are on the easternside of the chamber overlooking the pit. To the east
is a door while to the north is an altar.

43.name: Sacrificial Pit
desc: "   This is the bottom of the sacrificial pit.  Long ago it would have been
death to be in here.  Now it seems something is happening, some changes the
evil elves are introducing in to their city.  But that's all that can be
determined.

44.name: Westernside of Chamber
desc: "     You are on the westernside of the main chamber overlooking a sacrificial
pit. To the north is an altar.

45.name: The Altar
desc: "     You are standing infront of a highly and freshly bloodstained altar.
Engraved on the top of the altar is a giant spider witha human head. Looking
down from the altar you see a large sacrificial pit. Maybe you will get to
be one!

46.name: Slave Cells
desc: "     This is the main room to the cell chambers for the slaves to be
sacrificed. You notice there are no guards around.

47.name: Slave Pen
desc: "     Rotten meat and breads lie about the floor while shackles hang from the
walls. The room reeks of death. You almost become nauseated and decide to leave
the room since you were obviously too late to save the slaves.

48.name: Dais
desc: "     You stand upon a dais behind the altar. Above you is a enormous illusion
of a female drow turning into a giant spider and back again. There is a door
to the west.

49.name: The Treasury
desc: "     This is obviously only a temporary storage place for the collected
treasure being rather bare.

50.name: Weaponsmaster's Chamber
desc: "     This one person bedchamber is very elegant. The owner must be held in high
to get this kind of treatment.
